result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin Donte Price

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melvin Donte Price appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall for William Rakestraw in court for Melvin Donte Price.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rakestraw appears via telephone. 

Case in Court for Order to Show Case hearing.  Attorney Rakestraw has recently been retained and is unable to appear in person.  State is ordered to turnover all discovery within 3 days of today's date.  Defendant allowed to appear via zoom for next hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melvin Donte Price appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status conference.  Court previously granted Attorney Harris' Motion to Withdraw as counsel and appears today as friend of the court.  New counsel has not been appointed by the Public Defender's Office yet. If no appointment is made by next court date, Court orders that Attorney Tom Reed or a designee appear to provide updates regarding the appointment status.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melvin Donte Price not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Melvin Donte Price.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Status conference. Defense has received discovery from the State. Motion to Withdraw as counsel filed and GRANTED.  Defendant is eligible for Pubic Defender appointment.  Counsel advised to contact PD's office regarding need for appointment.  Defense granted approval to appear via zoom for next hearing. Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Status of Counsel hearing.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
from Defendant dated 7/12/2022, received and filed.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Melvin Donte Price not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 7/05/2022 as the deadline for the State to confirm that all discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports to be turned over to defense. Court sets 08/05/2022 as the deadline to file any motions or plea forms.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Melvin Donte Price in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Melvin Donte Price in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 14CF5563. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Z. Szalacinski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Melvin Donte Price in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Melvin Donte Price in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
